data.title: THE CHOSEN ‘VIEW’
data.meta_description: A soap actress, the wife of an NFL quarterback and a survivor of MTV’s “Real World” are the last three standing in daytime TV’s hot new...
data.text:
A soap actress, the wife of an NFL quarterback and a survivor of MTV’s “Real World” are the last three standing in daytime TV’s hot new drama – who’ll be the new co-host on “The View“?

The winner of the race to replace Lisa Ling, who left last year to host a National Geographic adventure series, will be instantly catipulted to fame as the youngest member of the morning-TV coffee klatch.

Barbara Walters announced the finalists at the top of yesterday’s show – after two months in which 21 women were tried out in Ling’s former seat.

The three finalists: Rachel Campos, who appeared on MTV’s “The Real World: San Francisco“; Elisabeth Hasselbeck, who was on “Survivor: The Australian Outback” when she was known as Elisabeth Filarski before marrying Redskins quarterback Tim Hasselbeck, and Erin Hershey Presley, a member of the cast of the soap-opera “Port Charles.”

“Our producers, Barbara [Walters] and I included, and our co-hosts sat around and talked a lot and took into account what our viewers wrote in,” said “View” co-executive producer Bill Geddie. “If I had to say who got the most mail, it would be these three people.”

Geddie said Campos, Hasselbeck and Presley were told they were “finalists” last Friday.

“There was a larger pool of between seven to nine women before we made up our minds,” Geddie said.

Each of the finalists will co-host for a week – comprised of four shows – with Campos co-hosting this week, Presley next week and Hasselbeck the week after that.

Walters says she will announce the winner on “The View” Nov. 24.

—-

SEEKING NICE ‘VIEW’-ISH GIRL

“SERIOUS” – Rachel Campos, 32

Alumna of MTV’s “The Real World: San Francisco.”

“FASHIONABLE” – Elisabeth Hasselbeck, 26

From shoe designer, now of the Style Network, was a contestant on “Survivor: The Australian Outback,” surviving through the final four.

“DRAMA QUEEN” – Erin Hershey Presley, 27

Portrayed Alison Bartington on ABC’s “Port Charles.”
